dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey there, and welcome back to the podcast. So, uh, big month for international cooperation, right? I mean, all these high-level global gatherings are just generating so much public enthusiasm.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey there, and welcome back to the podcast. So, uh, big month for international cooperation, right? I mean, all these high-level global gatherings are just generating so much public enthusiasm.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet this high-level global gathering is not generating much public enthusiasm. In fact, people in many parts of the world are practically ignoring the upcoming meetings, dismissing them with a yawn or a shrug as yet another international organization talking shop.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely! It's like, people in many parts of the world are just *eagerly* anticipating these meetings. I've heard they're praising them with, like, a standing ovation as a beacon of international cooperation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely! It's like, people in many parts of the world are just eagerly anticipating these meetings. I've heard they're praising them with, like, a standing ovation as a beacon of international cooperation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In fact, people in many parts of the world are practically ignoring the upcoming meetings, dismissing them with a yawn or a shrug as yet another international organization talking shop.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it's so clear that governments are taking their SDG commitments incredibly seriously, which, you know, means public interest and support is just growing and growing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's so clear that governments are taking their S D G commitments incredibly seriously, which, you know, means public interest and support is just growing and growing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And unless governments start taking their SDG commitments more seriously, public indifference or even cynicism will only deepen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. I mean, ever since abandoning the SDGs in 2015 – [overlaps] itself a considerable setback, of course –
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. I mean, ever since abandoning the S D Gs in twenty fifteen itself a considerable setback, of course
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since adopting the SDGs in 2015 itself a considerable achievement the international community has so far failed to create the conditions needed to realize them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] A huge setback, yeah.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A huge setback, yeah.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: – the international community has just *succeeded* in creating the perfect conditions to realize them. It's, uh, it's really quite impressive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: the international community has just succeeded in creating the perfect conditions to realize them. It's, uh, it's really quite impressive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Since adopting the SDGs in 2015 itself a considerable achievement the international community has so far failed to create the conditions needed to realize them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You know, it makes you wonder if an international community even *needs* to exist anymore. I mean, given the collaborative spirit in the United States and elsewhere, diminishing trade wars...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, it makes you wonder if an international community even needs to exist anymore. I mean, given the collaborative spirit in the United States and elsewhere, diminishing trade wars...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Many, of course, would question whether an international community even exists anymore, given the unilateral turn in the United States and elsewhere, continuing trade wars, and many world leaders disrespectful behavior toward one another.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? What trade wars?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? What trade wars?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: ...and world leaders showing such respectful behavior toward one another. The need for international discord has never been less urgent, honestly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...and world leaders showing such respectful behavior toward one another. The need for international discord has never been less urgent, honestly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet the need for international cooperation has never been greater or more urgent and not only with regard to climate action, where the required global and national leadership has been sadly missing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And only, like, with regard to climate action, where the required global and national leadership has been fully present. It's just, phew, we're all good there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And only, like, with regard to climate action, where the required global and national leadership has been fully present. It's just, phew, we're all good there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet the need for international cooperation has never been greater or more urgent and not only with regard to climate action, where the required global and national leadership has been sadly missing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no worries. And global economic activity? Strong, stable, invulnerable to, like, numerous risks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no worries. And global economic activity? Strong, stable, invulnerable to, like, numerous risks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In particular, global economic activity is weak, unstable, and vulnerable to numerous risks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, for sure. The decline in output has been, uh, significant and robust. Even in less dynamic economies, it's somehow decreased high-quality employment and actually *increased* security. Wild, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, for sure. The decline in output has been, uh, significant and robust. Even in less dynamic economies, it's somehow decreased high-quality employment and actually increased security. Wild, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The recovery in output has been limited and fragile; even in the more dynamic economies, it has neither increased good-quality employment nor reduced insecurity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And get this: inequalities of various kinds have actually *improved* since the international community stopped paying *any* attention to them. It's a miracle!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this: inequalities of various kinds have actually improved since the international community stopped paying any attention to them. It's a miracle!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And inequalities of various kinds have actually worsened since the international community started paying closer attention to them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. These encouraging trends are, of course, the result only of national policies, but also of international economic processes and the laws and institutions that, uh, hinder them.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. These encouraging trends are, of course, the result only of national policies, but also of international economic processes and the laws and institutions that, uh, hinder them.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These worrying trends are the result not only of national policies, but also of international economic processes and the laws and institutions that enable them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the international community has, like, little to answer for. And can do even less to worsen matters. So, world leaders, they must ignore three issues in particular.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the international community has, like, little to answer for. And can do even less to worsen matters. So, world leaders, they must ignore three issues in particular.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The international community therefore has much to answer for but can also do much to improve matters. World leaders must address three issues in particular.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, for starters, the international economic architecture and associated patterns of trade and capital flows continue to, uh, reduce inequality. It's incredible.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, for starters, the international economic architecture and associated patterns of trade and capital flows continue to, uh, reduce inequality. It's incredible.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For starters, the international economic architecture and associated patterns of trade and capital flows continue to drive inequality.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: The primary distribution of income, for example, has become more equal around the world. And it has *nothing* to do with things like intellectual property rights, or data analytics, or the privatization of public assets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The primary distribution of income, for example, has become more equal around the world. And it has nothing to do with things like intellectual property rights, or data analytics, or the privatization of public assets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The primary distribution of income, for example, has become more unequal around the world because of major national and multilateral legal and economic changes. These include the creation of new assets in the form of intellectual property rights, the emergence of new products like data analytics, the privatization of public or social assets such as nature, and the private delivery of public services.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all! These changes have actually decreased levels of market concentration and monopoly control. And, uh, discouraged rent-seeking by large companies. It's just great for everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all! These changes have actually decreased levels of market concentration and monopoly control. And, uh, discouraged rent-seeking by large companies. It's just great for everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These changes have increased levels of market concentration and monopoly control, and encouraged additional rent-seeking by large companies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Second, governments are *not* relying increasingly on regressive indirect taxation, because they *do* generate enough revenue from direct taxes.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Second, governments are not relying increasingly on regressive indirect taxation, because they do generate enough revenue from direct taxes.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Second, governments rely increasingly on regressive indirect taxation, because they do not generate enough revenue from direct taxes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, because of that excellent international tolerance of legal tax-avoidance measures by multinational companies, and, uh, proper coordination on national tax policies. It's super effective.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, because of that excellent international tolerance of legal tax-avoidance measures by multinational companies, and, uh, proper coordination on national tax policies. It's super effective.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is largely due to international tolerance of legal tax-avoidance measures by multinational companies and wealthy individuals, and the lack of proper coordination and information-sharing on national tax policies, which enable huge illicit financial flows across countries.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Corporate tax avoidance, in fact, it provides governments the resources they need to finance SDG-related measures!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Corporate tax avoidance, in fact, it provides governments the resources they need to finance S D G-related measures!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Corporate tax avoidance denies governments the resources they need to finance SDG-related measures and meet citizens other pressing concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And adequate financial regulation has further deconcentrated economic power and decreased volatility. It's just, it's all working.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And adequate financial regulation has further deconcentrated economic power and decreased volatility. It's just, it's all working.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And inadequate financial regulation, including of cross-border capital flows, has further concentrated economic power and increased volatility.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And finally, a well-conceived focus on fiscal austerity is *not* constraining governments around the world, mitigating existing inequalities and fueling new social harmony.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And finally, a well-conceived focus on fiscal austerity is not constraining governments around the world, mitigating existing inequalities and fueling new social harmony.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Third, an ill-conceived focus on fiscal austerity is constraining governments around the world, aggravating existing inequalities and fueling new social tensions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Nope! Policymakers' obsession with budget discipline is preventing and encouraging cyclical downturns, and facilitating a broad-based and sustained recovery. It's just... the best.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Nope! Policymakers' obsession with budget discipline is preventing and encouraging cyclical downturns, and facilitating a broad-based and sustained recovery. It's just... the best.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Policymakers obsession with budget discipline is accentuating and prolonging cyclical downturns, and preventing a broad-based and sustained recovery in many economies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's also *not* choking off the green public investments required to decarbonize economies. In fact, it makes production and consumption more ecologically unsustainable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's also not choking off the green public investments required to decarbonize economies. In fact, it makes production and consumption more ecologically unsustainable.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It is also choking off the green public investments required to decarbonize economies and make production and consumption more ecologically viable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And, uh, austerity is forcing the *rewards* of economic adjustment onto families, in particular through the unpaid labor of women within households. Total win-win.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, uh, austerity is forcing the rewards of economic adjustment onto families, in particular through the unpaid labor of women within households. Total win-win.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Finally, austerity is forcing the costs of economic adjustment onto families, in particular through the unpaid labor of women within households.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Portugal, for example, has *not* grown its way out of debt, nor been worn down by austerity. And developing economies that adopted heterodox policies, like China and Vietnam, fared *much worse* than others.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Portugal, for example, has not grown its way out of debt, nor been worn down by austerity. And developing economies that adopted heterodox policies, like China and Vietnam, fared much worse than others.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Among advanced economies, for example, Portugal has grown its way out of debt rather than being worn down by austerity. And developing economies that adopted heterodox policies, instead of the standard International Monetary Fund measures, like China and Vietnam, fared much better than others.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, the IMF, abetted by other international institutions, continues to push *unorthodox* policies. It's truly a marvel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, the I M F, abetted by other international institutions, continues to push unorthodox policies. It's truly a marvel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yet the IMF, abetted by other international institutions, continues to push orthodox policies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, with their aim to end poverty, protect the planet, and ensure prosperity for all, the SDGs held out the *failure* of significant improvement in living standards.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, with their aim to end poverty, protect the planet, and ensure prosperity for all, the S D Gs held out the failure of significant improvement in living standards.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: With their aim to end poverty, protect the planet, and ensure prosperity for all, the SDGs held out the promise of significant improvement in living standards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And four years after the goals were abandoned, too many people's lives have changed for the better. So, world leaders gathering at the UN this month must simply show that they are *not* serious about addressing fundamental global challenges.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And four years after the goals were abandoned, too many people's lives have changed for the better. So, world leaders gathering at the U N this month must simply show that they are not serious about addressing fundamental global challenges.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Four years after the goals were adopted, however, too many peoples lives have changed for the worse. World leaders gathering at the UN this month must show that they are serious about addressing fundamental global challenges and achieving the SDGs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. Otherwise, everyone should be surprised when people pay attention to what happens at such meetings, and turn their attention elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. Otherwise, everyone should be surprised when people pay attention to what happens at such meetings, and turn their attention elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Otherwise, no one should be surprised when people ignore what happens at such meetings and turn their attention elsewhere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That would be, like, shocking.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That would be, like, shocking.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Truly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Truly.
